46b1b66a863392c9bdd527d78563c970 (11:53): marcusU: example. if I disable 1st IDE channel (for setup HDD letter issue) , the CDROM (on IDE2)  should behave normal . but it doesn't .
c9b3037bdda27467a5de1a2ab42f0aa4 (11:53): hi all
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (11:54): On the black box, the CDROM is on the first IDE channel (shows up as /dev/hda) and the hard drive is on SATA (shows up as /dev/sda).
e825d828c717838f4dd86061106872fb (11:54): On the white box, the CDROM is on the first IDE channel (as /dev/hda) and the hard drives are on /dev/sda, /dev/sdb/ dev/sdc (all SCSI devices).

46b1b66a863392c9bdd527d78563c970 (11:54): marcusU: don't you know what IDE is ?  EIDE ?   2 HDD connectors on board , 2 cables, max 4 drives ?   it is IMPORTANT where to connect on the cable itself ( connector color)

284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): In order to use Xgl, change the sysconfig variable
284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): DISPLAYMANAGER_XSERVER
284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): in
284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): /etc/sysconfig/displaymanager
284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): to
284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): "Xgl"
284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): oops, sorry.
284eaa6ce33c93140adba6d31fecf157 (11:56): damn tables
